verses.name: Proverbs 9:12
verses.text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:13
verses.text: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:14
verses.text: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:15
verses.text: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

verses.name: Proverbs 9:16
verses.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:17
verses.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
